# Setting up Data
```{python}
 #| echo: true
 #| eval: true
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

data = pd.read_csv("wdi.csv")
```

## Exploratory Data Analysis
```{python}
gdp_summary = data['gdp_per_capita'].describe()
print(gdp_summary)

inflation_summary = data['inflation_rate'].describe()
print(inflation_summary)

gdp_growthrate = data['unemployment_rate'].describe()
print(gdp_growthrate)
```

## Analysis
#### GDP-Per-Capita
The average GDP per capita is $20,345.71, with a wide range from $259.03 to $240,862.18. The median is $7,587.59, showing significant variation across countries.
#### Inflation Rate
The average inflation rate is 12.49%, ranging from -6.69% to 171.21%. The median rate is 7.97%, with high variability indicated by a large standard deviation.
#### GDP-Growth-Rate
The average GDP growth rate is 4.37%, with values ranging from -28.76% to 63.44%. The median growth rate is 4.20%.

## Data Plots
### GDP-Per-Capita across Countries
```{python}
#| echo: false
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.bar(data = data, x = 'life_expectancy', height = 'gdp_per_capita', color='skyblue')
plt.xlabel('Life Expectancy')
plt.ylabel('GDP per Capita (USD)')
plt.title('GDP per Capita by Life Expectancy')
plt.figtext(0.5, -0.1, 'Figure 1: Bar plot showing GDP per capita by country.', ha='center', fontsize=10)
plt.figtext(0.5, -0.15, 'Source:  World Development Indicators', ha='center', fontsize=10)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
```

### Unemployment Rate By Total Population
```{python}
#| echo: false
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.scatter(data = data, x = 'unemployment_rate', y = 'total_population', color='skyblue')
plt.xlabel('Unemployment Rate')
plt.ylabel('Total Population')
plt.title('Unemployment Rate by Total Population')
plt.figtext(0.5, -0.1, 'Figure 1: Scatter plot showing unemployment rate by total population.', ha='center', fontsize=10)
plt.figtext(0.5, -0.15, 'Source:  World Development Indicators', ha='center', fontsize=10)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
```

### Key Statistics
```{python}
agg_stats = data.groupby('unemployment_rate')['total_population'].agg([
    'mean', 'max'
]).reset_index()
agg_stats.columns = ['Unemployment Rate', 'Mean Population', 'Max Population']
print(agg_stats.head(5))

agg_stats = data.groupby('life_expectancy')['gdp_per_capita'].agg([
    'mean', 'max'
]).reset_index()
agg_stats.columns = ['Life Expectancy', 'Mean GDP-Per-Capita', 'Max GDP-Per-Capita']
print(agg_stats.head(5))
```
